item.title: Quick Guide of Using Google Home to Control Smart Devices
item.description: What you need to get started Before using Google Home to control your devices, make sure you meet the following conditions. A Google Home device, or Android phone with Google Assistant. Latest Google Home App. Latest Google App (Android only) A Google account. The device display language must be set to English US. IBRIGHT App and a related account. Smart devices. Add devices in IBRIGHT App (Refer to App Instruction) You can skip this part if you’ve already added some devices to your IBRIGHT account, and in the meantime, the devices’ names are easily recognized.

item.title: Quick Guide of Using Amazon Echo to Control Smart Devices
item.description: What you need to get started Before using Echo to control your smart devices, make sure you meet the following conditions. Stable Wi-Fi network which could access to Amazon server. (For mainland China users) An Echo device, including Echo, Echo Tap, or Echo Dot. An Amazon account. (If you don’t have an Amazon account, click here to register) IBRIGHT App and a related account. Smart devices. Add devices in IBRIGHT App (Refer to App Instruction) You can skip this part if you’ve already added some devices to your IBRIGHT account, and in the meantime, the devices’ names are easily recognized.
